intro: Orchis morio f. sublaxiflora, commonly known as the lax-flowered early purple orchid, is a hybrid orchid species native to Europe. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem bearing numerous purple or violet flowers with a distinctive hooded lip. The leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal. This plant thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows. It is a short-lived perennial, typically flowering in late spring to early summer.
